result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan William Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment to include Anger Management and/or Criminal Thinking per agent.  Not operate m/v without valid DL.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Ryan William Franklin in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties recv'd and reviewed PSI.  Atty. Hughes makes corrections - page 19 and page 20.  Parties ready to proceed to sentencing.  Atty. Hoffman gives recommendation and argument - 5 yrs. I.C./3 yrs. E.S..  Atty. Hughes gives recommendation and argument for imposed & stayed prison w/lengthy probation, 1 yr. jail and hefty fine.  DE makes statement.  Court advises constitutional rights and felony admonishment.   Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
WI State Prison for 9 years (3 years Initial Confinement/6 years Extended Supervision) 
103 days credit 
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling to include Anger Management and/or Criminal Thinking per agent
2 yrs. suspension of DL
Not operate m/v w/o valid DL
$518.00 Costs, DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees
DNA Surcharge
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 20, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Day 2 -  8:36 am. Attorney Michael Hughes in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Scott Steinhorst appears.  DE now here 8:50.  DE wishes to apologize to the Court for the tardiness.  Back on record 9:02. Jury in.  Sate calls M. Koch, DOJ crime lab, S&T.  State offers exh. #6, recv'd.  Atty. Hughes cross exam.  State rests at this time 9:16.  Jury out.  Back on record 9:25.  Atty. Hughes states DE will not testify.  Court does collaque of DE.  DE wishes not to testify.  Atty. Hughes concurs.  Court goes thru instructions with atty's.  #6035 State would like all three, Atty. Hughes makes statement on possession on ground. Court exclude sentence.  Element #3.  Off record.  Back on record 10:00.  Jury in 10:03.  Defense rests.  Court instructs jury on verdict/deliberations. State does closing argument 10:21.  Atty. Hughes does closing argument 10:31.  Atty Hoffman does rebuttal 11:07. 11:25 Court does final instructions.  Clerk strikes alternate #325.  Clerk sworn in bailiff.  Jury deliberating 11:33.  Jury has 5 questions 1:18.  Parties believe cannot answer any.  Court makes response and parties agree is sufficient. Question 1:43.  Court gives jury exhibit 7. On the record 2:18 Jury has reached a verdict.  Court reads verdict.  Guilty of poss. of controlled substance w/intent. Court polls jury. Parties accept the verdict as true verdict.  Jury excused.  State makes motion to revoke bond and enter judgment.  Atty. Hughes makes argument, not a flight risk, has a significant cash bond posted and has shown up for court. DE makes statement.  Court denies DE's request.  Report to be back by Oct. 26, 2017.
Exhibits 1-8 (Exhibits 1, 3 & 8 are with SCSD in evidence room)

8:35 a.m. Attorney Michael Hughes.  DE not here in court yet.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Scott Steinhorst appears in court.  Court going to give DE some time to show.  8:54 DE here. Court addresses some motions and questioning of officers. Motion to exclude witness and intake inmate form.  State responds to witness of officer Henke. State has no intention of using intake form.  Atty. Hughes makes argument.  Not reasonable time before trial of witness.  Court had a scheduling order in place so should be an exclusion of the witness.  Court doesn't believe there is any prejudice to defense, deny defense motion. Reports of cellular phone only the new section the defense recv'd.  State has no intention of using that information unless defense goes into it.  Court will proceed with that issue.  Court advises modification of instruction #158.  Atty Hughes requests adjournment.  State objects.  Judge denies the request.  Jury in at 9:23 a.am.  Clerk sworn in jury panel.  Court excused #226, called up #3892.  Court excused #960, called up #1309.  Atty Hoffman does voir dire.  Atty Hughes does voir dire.  Atty Hoffman objects.  Court tells Atty. Hughes to move on. 10:24- Atty's do strikes.  Clerk gets the potential 13 jurors.  Judge has sidebar with counsel. 10:30 Jury panel sworn in. Recess 10:35.  Back on the record with jury 10:57.  Court instructs jury.  Atty. Hoffman does opening 11:10.  Atty. Hughes does opening 11:18.  Jury out.  Atty. Hoffman states Atty. Hughes has mentioned in voir dire and in opening on DE's arrest, leading jury to speculate unlawful arrest and who officers wanted to target.  Court listened to both openings and do not believe Atty. Hughes opened the door for status of DE.  11:44 State calls deputy Mitch Schauff, Iowa Co. sheriff's office, S&T.  Witness ID'd defendant. Atty. Hughes objects, Court sustains and stricken from record.  Atty. Hoffman offers exh. # 1, Atty. Hughes objects to chain of custody by this witness, Court withholds ruling for now.  State offers exhibit #2, recv'd.  Break 12:01.  Atty. Hughes makes argument on question arrest no stipulation would make this better and requests mistrial. Back on record w/o jury 1:00.  Court makes determination of mistrial is not appropriate at this time.  Court addresses gallery on gestures during testimony.  Jury back 1:05.  State shows video of stop. 1:40 Atty. Hoffman continue direct of witness.  Atty. Hughes cross exam witness.  Atty. Hoffman redirect.  Atty. Hughes recross.  Atty. Hoffman calls deputy Benjamin Henke, SCSD, S&T. Atty. Hughes cross exam.  Atty. Hoffman calls deputy Patrick Wex, SCSD, S&T.  Atty. Hughes objects, relevance.  Court sustains. Atty. Hughes objects, same objection.  Court overrules. Atty. Hughes cross exam witness. 2:15 pm Atty. Hoffman calls detective Scott Steinhorst, SCSD, S&T. State offers #8.  Atty. Hughes still has the same objection as did for #1 for chain of custody.  Court holds off for now on receiving exhibits #1 & #8.  State offers #7, recv'd. Published to jury. State offers #3, recv'd. Jury Break 2:35 pm.  Atty. Hoffman would like more on objection on chain of custody. Atty. Hughes states chain of custody with Hodges.  Jury back 2:58 pm.  Atty. Hughes cross exam witness. Atty. Hoffman redirect. Atty. Hughes needs sidebar. Jury excused.  4th amendment violation.  State states questioning not surprised.  Jury back in.  Atty. Hughes continues cross.  State redirect. Atty. Hughes recross. 3:30 pm  Atty. Hoffman calls Sgt. James Hodges, SCSD, S&T. Atty. Hughes cross exam.  Atty. Hoffman calls R. Kiffe, Crime lab analyst forensic scientist, S&T.  State offers exh. 4 & 5, recv'd.  Atty. Hughes cross exam.  State redirect. Atty. Hughes recross. Jury Break for the day 4:15, Jury to be back by 8:45. Court talks to parties about jury instructions, specificially 6035.  Parties to be here by 8:30.  Go on record by 9:00.  Off the record 4:25.

records.addlTxt: Judge Letter jury instruction on squad video and muting sections
from Atty Hoffman to Judge Screnock

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motions in limine filed 8/24/16.  No changes to witness lists.  #3 motion State be prohibited from DNA of defendant - State has no problem not introducing that.  Court grants motion #3.  #1 motion on witness list & experts.  Atty. Hughes argues about witness/expert of det. Steinhorst.  Atty. rec'vd report of witness on 8/3/17.  Various opinions on reports.  State states most of the opinions would not be used.  #2 prohibiting any witness to testify on distribution rather than personal use.  State calls detective Scott Steinhorst, S&T.  Atty. Hughes cross exam witness.  State objects, argumentive. Court sustains.  Atty. Hughes makes argument on Dahlbert rule and after testimony State should be prohibited from letting this officer testify at trial on personal use or distribution.  Personal observations no training on this area.  State makes argument and states this kind of testimony has been used in lots of cases. Type of questioning on search warrant should be barred at trial.  State has met dahlbert requirements in this case.  Court states detective Steinhorst is qualified for expert and specialized knowledge for testimony.  Court will not prohibit detective Steinhorst from testimony.   Atty. Hughes states will probably get into search warrant.  State makes argument of relevance.  Court needs to think about this decision.  Court not to allow instruct jury to ask questions, parties should present their case to jury.  Sequestionation of witness'.  Note taking of jurors is allowed.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hughes notes FPT today and he talked to ADA Hoffman today.  DE is requesting reset of FPT/JT.  State is in agreement.  Court so orders/will have his assistant set JT and send notices.  Bond continued.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hughes states PTC was held but matter not resolved.  NG pleas continue and matter to be put on JT calendar.  Bond continued.

Pre-trial conference at 02-05-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 02-16-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hughes acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads not guilty.  Court notes matter will be set for trial.  Atty Hughes requests PTC as there hasn't been one yet.  State agrees w/PTC being set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State opposes to the bond modification.  Attorney Hughes argues bond modification.  Father posted bond and is requesting bond be modified to $1000.00 cash.  Court questions defendant regarding his employment status.  State argues to have bond amount remain as is.  State notes warrant and criminal history.  Court questions Attorney Hughes re: loan amounts and defendant incarceration status.  Court denies motion to modify cash bond.  Cash bond continues.  No restitution amounts at issue.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Sgt. Hodges appears.  State callses James Hodges, SCSD sargeant, S&T.  Witness ID'd defendant.  Atty. Hughes cross exam.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Arraignment scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recently appointed.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states he just discovered that there is a conflict and new counsel will need to be appointed.  Requests reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 09-11-2015 10:15 am.
Return date at 09-23-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan William Franklin by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Ryan William Franklin in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests $2,500 cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
